cmp: 匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
比 ((particle used for comparison and "-er than")/to compare/to contrast/to gesture (with hands)/ratio, associate with/be near)
匕 (an ancient type of spoon, dagger/ladle)
mng: to mix, to mingle, muddled, to drift along, to muddle along, to pass for, to get along with sb, thoughtless, reckless
confused, dirty, to mix, muddy, variant of 渾|浑[hun2]

exm.mng: to mix, to mingle, muddled, to drift along, to muddle along, to pass for, to get along with sb, thoughtless, reckless
confused, dirty, to mix, muddy, variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to obscure, to confuse, to mix up, to blur, to mislead
to mix up, to confuse one thing with another
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
person of mixed blood, half-breed, mulatto
civil war, muddled warfare, rough and tumble, battle royal, free fight
mixed in as part of a community, hiding one's identity, occupying a position while not deserving it
primal chaos, formless mass before creation in Chinese mythology, muddled, innocent as a baby
